creator: salodini.ivan@gmail.com
text:
Using the following .htaccess file the server fails rewriting the "index2.php?page=portfolio"
The server rewriting to "portfolio/?page=portfolio"

The other three rules works perfectly


----------------------------------------------
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /

RewriteRule  ^contact$    ./index2.php?page=contact
RewriteRule  ^portfolio$  ./index2.php?page=portfolio
RewriteRule  ^profile$    ./index2.php?page=profile
RewriteRule  ^resume$	  ./index2.php?page=resume
----------------------------------------------

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: I think you got your "to" and "from" backwards.  But if you enabled the RewriteLog or looked more closely at your access log you'd probably discover your regular expression doesn't match the input, due to the trailing slash or any number of other misconfigurations that aren't bugs in the server.

creator: salodini.ivan@gmail.com
text:
Only one of the three rules below doesn't work...
The portfolio one.

RewriteRule  ^contact$    ./index2.php?page=contact
RewriteRule  ^portfolio$  ./index2.php?page=portfolio
RewriteRule  ^profile$    ./index2.php?page=profile
RewriteRule  ^resume$	  ./index2.php?page=resume



I've also tried

RewriteRule  ^portfolio$  index2.php?page=portfolio
RewriteRule  portfolio    index2.php?page=portfolio
RewriteRule  ^portfolio   index2.php?page=portfolio



On the other hand, removing the 'o', the following one rule works

RewriteRule  ^portfoli$   ./index2.php?page=portfolio

creator: salodini.ivan@gmail.com
text: The problem was that the in the system exists a folder 'portfolio'
